text.p: Following are some of the leading stories in Norwegian papers this morning.

- Prime Minister Torbjoern Jagland says it will be increasingly difficult for the Labour minority government to continue in power after this year's election in September if support for the right-wing parties increases. A stronger Conservative majority would lead the country into higher prices and interest rates, he says.
- Engineering and construction Kvaerner ASA will consider buying a shipyard in the United States if it is awarded a contract to build a floating airbase for the American Navy.
- The government will spend 3.5 billion crowns on upgrading the country's ports over the next four years, which is 45 percent more than last year's budget.
- Ship owner John Fredriksen plans to take over the Bermuda registrated tanker company London & Overseas Freighters Ltd.

- Head of Aker RGI's board, Lars Christensen, did not support the company's decision to buy a large block of preference shares in Norway's largest insurer Storebrand ASA. As a result Christensen will decline to be reelected at the annual general assembly.
